title: Lamb Souvlaki with Tzatziki
description: Juicy marinated lamb cubes seared on skewers and served with a cool, bright tzatziki sauce. The dish balances herb-forward Mediterranean flavors with a citrusy garlic marinade and quick-grilled char for a weeknight or weekend centerpiece.

ingredients.display_name: boneless lamb leg or shoulder, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes

ingredients.notes: strain for 10 minutes if very watery
seed, grate, and squeeze out excess water
minced, reserve some for marinade and some for tzatziki
used in marinade and for brushing
one tbsp for marinade, one tbsp for tzatziki and finishing
divide between marinade, lamb seasoning, and tzatziki
soak in cold water briefly to mellow bite

ingredients.display_name: pita bread or flatbreads, warmed (for serving)

ingredients.notes: if using wooden skewers, soak in water 30 minutes before grilling

ingredients.display_name: olive oil spray or brush (for grill)

steps.text: Prepare marinade: in a bowl combine olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, dried oregano, chopped thyme, ground cumin, half the kosher salt and half the black pepper. Whisk until emulsified.

Marinate lamb: place cubed lamb in a shallow dish or resealable bag, pour marinade over meat, toss to coat thoroughly, cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes and up to 4 hours (shorter if pressed for time).

Prepare tzatziki: grate the seeded cucumber and squeeze out excess liquid. In a bowl combine Greek yogurt, grated cucumber, minced garlic, chopped mint, remaining lemon juice, remaining salt and pepper. Stir to combine and chill until serving.
Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat and lightly oil grates or pan. If using wooden skewers, ensure they have been soaked ahead of time.
Thread marinated lamb onto skewers, leaving a small gap between pieces for even cooking. Discard excess marinade left in the dish to avoid flare-ups.

Grill skewers over direct heat: place skewers on preheated grill or hot pan, cook until well browned and slightly charred, turning every 2-3 minutes for even cooking. Target medium doneness or internal temperature ~140-145°F (60-63°C) for slightly pink, about 8-10 minutes total depending on cube size. Brush with a little oil if needed while cooking.
Rest meat: remove skewers from heat and transfer to a tray. Tent loosely with foil and rest for 5 minutes to allow juices to redistribute.

Warm pita and assemble: warm pita bread briefly on the grill or in a hot pan. Serve skewers whole or slide meat from skewers into warmed pita with sliced tomato, red onion, a generous spoonful of tzatziki, and a drizzle of extra lemon juice and olive oil if desired.
